channel.title: I think
channel.description:
I think that the next time a bot is released, the board in which it is in should be INVISIBLE to people who haven't had an interview with Mopar or any other highly known and trusted person
Of course you know the reason ;) (in case you don't, we don't want the Jagex Employees to have access to the source of our bots; it helps them better understand [b]how[/b] our bots work, and therefore making their game more anti-cheatable)

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

I learned Java through a class

3 years so far, but i jsut recently got into this cheating stuff… well, community cheats after somebody posted some code on another site, i liked it and found mopars site.

Ive been forced to learn alot of java to compete in state competitions and stuff like that, which is basically: how is this code wrong? and what will this output?

Ive read a few books though, maybe 4 or 5, onw im reading now is pretty cool, its called “Developing games in Java”

ha, u know about me too

btw… i know nothing of this stuff you guys are talking about, although i can learn languages pretty quick now, ive never decompiled code, and the first time ive ever seen decompiled code was when that person sent me part of an old client…

anyways, you will be seeing more of me around here, I though cheating communities were bad until while reading these posts ive seen that it isnt the programmers that are bad, its the leechers

Read full topic

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @Xerxes Xerxes

@Xerxes wrote:

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

weaselforce:

poor mopar. 300 requests per day

lol hell yea that would happen, please dont

besides, yall are getting WAAAAAY ahead of yourselves, we cant even get a decent deob yet, lets focus on one thing at a time instead of talking about the “next bot”

[quote=“Ben, post:21, topic:2946”]Lol you read books to learn Java?
You got any peice of knowledge you want on the net, all you gotta do is ask google your question and you get an endless amount of answers

I learned Java just the way you all say you shouldn’t. I copied code, I modified code, I made scripts, but I never read a book. After a week or two I got the hang of it.

The most important thing in learning how to program is reading the code, the more you read the code the better you understand it - just like in your own language. The more your parents talked to you when you were a baby the faster you learned how to talk.

Ok I got carried away for abit…

And another thing, I doubt there will be a bot out if you won’t be sharing your code. There is no RegeX, Sean, Saev or Kaitnieks to do anything, it’s just you all. If not each of you will share his knowledge you’ll probably never reach results.

And if you think that this engine update was because they were taking a look at your bots then you are probably wrong, because he started working on it 6 months ago. They knew since RSC age that their client’s sourcecode was being decompiled and deobfuscated and it probably was on their To do list for about a year now.[/quote]

thats how I learned Java and SCAR ;D

Read full topic

@PaulT wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:1, topic:2946”]I think that the next time a bot is released, the board in which it is in should be INVISIBLE to people who haven’t had an interview with Mopar or any other highly known and trusted person

Of course you know the reason (in case you don’t, we don’t want the Jagex Employees to have access to the source of our bots; it helps them better understand how our bots work, and therefore making their game more anti-cheatable)[/quote]

I think too, but I don’t tell anyone.

Read full topic

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Ben, post:21, topic:2946”]I learned Java just the way you all say you shouldn’t. I copied code, I modified code, I made scripts, but I never read a book. After a week or two I got the hang of it.

[…]

And another thing, I doubt there will be a bot out if you won’t be sharing your code. There is no RegeX, Sean, Saev or Kaitnieks to do anything, it’s just you all. If not each of you will share his knowledge you’ll probably never reach results.[/quote]

Me too! Over the course of last summer though.

I resent that sentiment, but if that’s the way you feel then I’d like to point out that results can be achieved by sharing knowledge, not code. Knowledge > code. How do you think Kaitnieks and RegeX learned RS2? They were all part of the earlier kaitnieks.com client research boom (which has not been resurrected since Aryan). The way to get people to make something is to put them in a place where the only option is to work and collaborate (i.e., no autodeobs & no clue wtf happened to the client :P)

Read full topic

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @Akriam Akriam
item.description:
@Akriam wrote:

Good idea. I know some stupid Jagex staff member with 1 post just said he figured out a guys name from a PIC, probably a fake though. We don’t go hacking into JAgexes sightes and stuff. We dont look at there secret crap. They shouldnt do it to us. It takes away from the challenge. Those lazy but holes.

Read full topic

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @Ben Ben
item.description:
@Ben wrote:

Lol you read books to learn Java?
You got any peice of knowledge you want on the net, all you gotta do is ask google your question and you get an endless amount of answers

I learned Java just the way you all say you shouldn’t. I copied code, I modified code, I made scripts, but I never read a book. After a week or two I got the hang of it.

The most important thing in learning how to program is reading the code, the more you read the code the better you understand it - just like in your own language. The more your parents talked to you when you were a baby the faster you learned how to talk.

Ok I got carried away for abit…

And another thing, I doubt there will be a bot out if you won’t be sharing your code. There is no RegeX, Sean, Saev or Kaitnieks to do anything, it’s just you all. If not each of you will share his knowledge you’ll probably never reach results.

And if you think that this engine update was because they were taking a look at your bots then you are probably wrong, because he started working on it 6 months ago. They knew since RSC age that their client’s sourcecode was being decompiled and deobfuscated and it probably was on their To do list for about a year now.

Read full topic

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @ShadowZ ShadowZ
item.description:
@ShadowZ wrote:

Who said anything about you being a leech?
I only mentioned that you suggest that trusted members only should have access, and thats is the same thing as i think about having these ranks after you can actually see the board, and prevents faggex to get to it easily

I dont have anything against leeches, you, or anyone else here
Though, the rip of aryan was simply because of overusing… I mean cmon, every yew at varrock was chaos, around 30 autoers everytime…

Faggex killed this because it was extremely noticed and had to do something about it

Read full topic

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“ShadowZ, post:17, topic:2946”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=3311.msg32402#msg32402 date=1147880626]

I’d suggest to make a bot thats only viewable\downloadable by getting a rank

Like members and up… So it prevents leechers as on the forums as on runescape itself ( Like the wave of lvl 3’s at yews )

That is not the point. That is pure selfishness
This is about JAGEX getting access to the source, not about leechers
[/quote]

If leeches can get to it, jagex can aswell… :\

Speaking of selfishness…

I think that the next time a bot is released, the board in which it is in should be INVISIBLE to people who haven’t had an interview with Mopar or any other highly known and trusted person

it could be you, me, mopar, anyone trusted (Am I trusted? :o)

You basicly say that your trusted, and suggest that only trusted people can see the board[/quote]

Are you trying to say that I am a leech?
And yes, you are damn right I’m trusted >>

EDIT:

Speaking of selfishness…

You very obviously do not get the point. This is not about keeping the Bot to ourselves(and therefore being selfish); this is about keeping the bot away from Jagex.

Read full topic

Why won’t you start Pwnd? Too much talk, no action.

In order to learn Java, I’ve finished a 650 page “beginners” book.
I’ve ordered two more books to further my knowledge.

At least I didn’t say, “Like, omg, I have my own bot and deobfuscator for the new client. I must be leet hax, yo.”

item.title: I think
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“ShadowZ, post:6, topic:2946”]I’d suggest to make a bot thats only viewable\downloadable by getting a rank

Like members and up… So it prevents leechers as on the forums as on runescape itself ( Like the wave of lvl 3’s at yews )[/quote]
I think everyone should make thier own bots, keep them private. This eliminates JageX from getting a copy, and you all have unique systems and there will be less autoers to fight against. Plus, you earn the knowledge of java.

Read full topic
